intro: Tarenna eucrantha, commonly known as the white-flowered tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, spherical berries that are typically yellow when mature. Tarenna eucrantha is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
